node.title: Chris Bailey, lead singer of The Saints and 'co-creator of punk', dies
node.description: Chris Bailey, lead singer of legendary Australian rock band The Saints, has died.

node.title: Elon Musk won't be joining Twitter's board of directors, after all
node.description: Musk purchased a 9.2% stake in Twitter worth nearly $3 billion, becoming its largest shareholder.

node.title: NZ's Covid-19 death toll hits 500
node.description: There have been 7592 new community cases of Covid-19 reported today, with 640 in hospital and 11 further deaths taking Aotearoa's death toll to 500.

node.title: 'I didn't believe Shanghai in 2022 could be like this'
node.description: As China faces a Covid surge, residents are asking how far the government is willing to go.

node.title: More digging needed to unearth clues on 'unique' bird
node.description: Scientists have been puzzled by the discovery of an ancient bird with unique features near St Bathans in Central Otago.

node.title: Call for review of genetically modified tech regulation in NZ
node.description: It is time for a full review of genetically modified organisms and technologies, according to a groundbreaking report by the Productivity Commission.

node.title: Convicted smuggler Karel Šroubek to appeal against deportation again
node.description: An appeal by convicted drug smuggler Karel Šroubek against his deportation will be heard this week.

node.title: LynnMall attack: Security fears trumped mental health support
node.description: The Security Intelligence Service was calling the LynnMall knife attacker a terrorist for years, at the same time as courts were hearing he was a high, medium or even low-risk threat.

node.title: 'I don't believe that we're under a democracy' - Marsden Point protesters rally
node.description: Police say there are now 90 demonstrators outside the former Marsden Point refinery, but they remain peaceful.

node.title: Ram raiders hit luxury shops in Auckland
node.description: A stolen vehicle was found at the scene in Queen Street and a second vehicle was located nearby, police said. Audio

node.title: All Blacks Sevens beaten by Fiji in Singapore final
node.description: Fiji has beaten the All Blacks Sevens 28-17 in the final of the Singapore round of the World Series.

node.title: Singapore, Japan on list for Ardern's first overseas trip since Covid-19
node.description: The prime minister is heading a trade mission to Singapore and Japan with what she calls a clear message - "New Zealand is open for business".

node.title: Christchurch cuts council costs for struggling city centre businesses
node.description: Christchurch City Council has agreed to allocate up to $1.45 million to subsidise council costs that businesses face.

node.title: Napier Port lowers earnings foreast due to drop in cargo volume, labour shortages
node.description: Omicron outbreaks and pandemic-related port lockdowns in China had put additional pressure on global supply chains, a company statement to the stock exchange said.

node.title: Future tradies lining up to pick up tools
node.description: Trade training is booming with thousands more people signing up for apprenticeships since the pandemic began.

node.title: Covid-19: Bars still checking vaccine passes face flack
node.description: Some bars still requiring Covid-19 vaccine passes are finding themselves at the forefront of online activity by anti-mandate supporters. Audio

node.title: Bling going nowwhere - Hamilton
node.description: Seven-times world champion Lewis Hamilton has responded defiantly on Sunday after Formula One reminded drivers that jewellery cannot be worn during races.

node.title: Zelenskyy calls on U.S. and its allies to deliver more weapons immediately
node.description: The Ukrainian president says the West must step up military aid and stop fearing Russia.

node.title: The wartime president: Zelenskyy speaks with Scott Pelley in Kyiv
node.description: Ukraine's president speaks with Scott Pelley about Russia's invasion of Ukraine, and recently uncovered alleged war crimes in Kyiv suburb of Bucha.

node.title: Manchester City stay one point clear after draw with Liverpool
node.description: Manchester City remain one point clear of Liverpool at the top of the Premier League standings after the highly-anticipated clash of the giants ended in a 2-2 draw at the Etihad Stadium.

node.title: 'Absolute nuts': Hawke's Bay hospitals feel Omicron strain
node.description: Hawke's Bay has consistently had one of the highest, if not the highest Covid-19 hospitalisation rates of any area in the country over recent weeks.

node.title: World No. 1 Scottie Scheffler wins Masters
node.description: And just 14 months after a horrific car crash, Tiger Woods completed all 72 holes at Augusta.

node.title: Anti-mandate protesters remove tents from Dunedin's Octagon
node.description: All tents have been removed from Dunedin's Octagon, hours before the deadline for a group of anti-mandate protesters who have been there for two months to leave. Audio

node.title: Orange light setting should keep mask use requirement in schools - Baker
node.description: As the goverment considers this week whether to lower the country's traffic light settings, epidemiologist Michael Baker says the orange level should be changed to make indoor areas safer. Audio

node.title: Nelson coastal park finally on the right track
node.description: Contractors are busy doing earthworks to form the contours for a new coastal park in Nelson, which is expected to be complete before next summer.

node.title: Cyclone Fili set to hit North Island from Tuesday
node.description: Severe gales and heavy rain are expected to hit the northern and eastern North Island from tomorrow as Cyclone Fili approaches the North Island. Audio

node.title: MPs debate summonsing Russian ambassador to Parliament
node.description: MPs are debating the extraordinary step after the ambassador rebuffed two requests to appear before a committee to answer questions about Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

node.title: Police investigate death of two-year-old in Hamilton
node.description: Officers were flagged down in Heaphy Terrace about 11am on Saturday by the occupants of a vehicle who requested assistance with the girl.

node.title: Departing MP Wall's claims countered by ex-Labour Party president
node.description: A former Labour Party president says comments by outgoing MP Louisa Wall are unfair and untrue.

node.title: Protesters set up camp at former Mardsen Point refinery
node.description: A protest at the former Marsden Point oil refinery is being monitored by the police.
